{{Infobox software | name = Amazon DynamoDB | logo = | screenshot = | caption = | author = | developer = [[Amazon.com]] | released = 2012 | status = Active | latest release version = | latest release date = | frequently updated = yes | programming language = | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | language = English | genre = [[key-value store]] | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]] | website = {{URL|http://aws.amazon.com/dynamodb/ }} }} '''Amazon DynamoDB''' is a fully managed [[NoSQL]] [[database]] service that is offered by [[Amazon.com]] as part of the [[Amazon Web Services]] portfolio.{{cite web | url = http://www.zdnet.co.uk/news/cloud/2012/01/19/amazon-switches-on-dynamodb-cloud-database-service-40094849/ | title = Amazon switches on DynamoDB cloud database service | accessdate = 2012-01-21 | last = Clark | first = Jack | date = 2012-01-19 | work = ZDNet}} DynamoDB exposes a similar data model and derives its name from [[Dynamo_(storage_system)|Dynamo]], but has a different underlying implementation. Dynamo had a multi-master design requiring the client to resolve version conflicts whereas DynamoDB has a single master design. DynamoDB was announced by Amazon CTO [[Werner Vogels]] on January 18, 2012.{{cite web | url = http://www.allthingsdistributed.com/2012/01/amazon-dynamodb.html | title = http://www.allthingsdistributed.com/2012/01/amazon-dynamodb.html | title = Amazon DynamoDB â€“ a Fast and Scalable NoSQL Database Service Designed for Internet Scale Applications | accessdate = 2012-01-21 | last = Vogels | first = Werner | date = 2012-01-18 | work = All Things Distributed blog}} ==Overview== DynamoDB differs from other Amazon services by allowing developers to purchase a service based on [[throughput]], rather than [[computer data storage|storage]]. Although the database does not automatically [[Scalability|scale]], administrators can request more throughput and DynamoDB will spread the data and traffic over a number of servers using [[solid-state drive]]s, allowing predictable performance. It offers integration with [[Hadoop]] via [[Amazon Elastic MapReduce|Elastic MapReduce]]. DynamoDB is [[proprietary software]], but has been compared to a managed version of the [[open-source software]] database [[Apache Cassandra]].{{cite web | url = http://www.datastax.com/dev/blog/amazon-dynamodb | title = Amazon DynamoDB | accessdate = 2012-01-21 | last = Ellis | first = Jonathan | date = 2012-01-18 | work = Cassandra Developer Center | publisher = Datastax.com}} ==Language bindings== Languages with DynamoDB [[language binding|binding]] include [[Java (programming language)|Java]], [[Node.js]], [[.NET Framework|.NET]], [[Perl]], [[PHP]], [[Python (programming language)|Python]], [[Ruby (programming language)|Ruby]], and [[Erlang (programming language)|Erlang]].[http://aws.typepad.com/aws/2012/04/amazon-dynamodb-libraries-mappers-and-mock-implementations-galore.html Amazon DynamoDB Libraries, Mappers, and Mock Implementations Galore!] ==References==
==External links== * [http://aws.amazon.com/dynamodb/ Amazon DynamoDB Official Page] * {{YouTube|id=qIjPm_fKQ0Y|title=Getting Started with Amazon DynamoDB}} {{Amazon}} {{Cloud computing}} [[Category:Amazon.com]] [[Category:Cloud infrastructure]] [[Category:Web services]] [[Category:Infrastructure as a service]] [[Category:Distributed data stores]] [[Category:Structured storage]] [[Category:NoSQL]] [[de:Amazon Dynamo]] [[ja:Amazon DynamoDB]] [[ru:Amazon DynamoDB]]
